timeline.bodyText: Is there a way we can write these templates with line breaks? Without line breaks this is slow to review. Maybe it would make sense to even include a section in a comment with the code with #10 replaced with line breaks.
timeline.author: jacob314
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -11,7 +11,7 @@
       <option name="DART_TOPLEVEL" value="true" />
     </context>
   </template>
-  <template name="inh" value="class $NAME$ extends InheritedWidget {
  const $NAME$({
    Key key,
    @required Widget child,
  }) : assert(child != null),
       super(key: key, child: child);

  static $NAME$ of(BuildContext context) {
    return context.inheritFromWidgetOfExactType($NAME$) as $NAME$;
  }

  @override
  bool updateShouldNotify($NAME$ old) {
    return $SHOULD_NOTIFY$;
  }
}" description="New Inherited widget" toReformat="true" toShortenFQNames="true">

replies.bodyText:
I don't know about other ways of authoring these, but we could easily set up a build step in bin/plugin generate which copied dart snippets into these files in the right format. Then we'd be reviewing short dart files instead of single line xml.
cc @stevemessick @helin24
replies.author: devoncarew
